alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 1:25PM CDT until July 14 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Riley County in northeastern Kansas... Western Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Central Wabaunsee County in east central Kansas... Eastern Pottawatomie County in northeastern Kansas... Southeastern Nemaha County in northeastern Kansas... Western Jackson County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 125 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Havensville to 8 miles west of Emmett to 6 miles south of St. George, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wamego, Holton, Rossville, Alma, St. Marys, Dover, Silver Lake, Onaga, Maple Hill, McFarland, Paxico, Belvue, Emmett, Louisville, Circleville, Delia, Soldier, Havensville, Willard and Potawatomi Reservation. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 319 and 349. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Jackson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
